sources.title: The Sun Sets at Dawn (1950)
sources.description: Reporters gather as a young man who may be innocent waits to be the first in the prison's history to be killed by the electric chair.

sources.title: The Sun Sets at Dawn (1950)
sources.description: A reporter investigates the story of a young man who may have been wrongly convicted and sentenced to be executed. Watch on RetroFlix:Â  https://retroflix.org/the-sun-sets-at-dawn-1950/

sources.title: The Sun Sets at Dawn (1950) FILM NOIR
sources.description:
Stars: Sally Parr, Patrick Waltz, Walter Reed 
 Writer/Director: Paul Sloane

 A young man is wrongly convicted and sentenced to be executed. Reporters covering the execution relate the story, each from his own perspective.

sources.title: The Sun Sets At Dawn
sources.description: From IMDb : "A young man is wrongly convicted and sentenced to be executed. Reporters covering the execution relate the story, each from his own perspective." This film is already uploaded to the archives but was uploaded again so that viewers could enjoy the movie on line since the original file is not embedded into a player. Please note: This page wasn't created to impress anyone or compete with them, it was simply created so that others may be able to more easily enjoy the movie via streaming.

metadata.Plot: A young man awaits execution on death row for the murder of a political boss. Although h continues to protest his innocence, only his sweetheart, the prison priest, and the warden and his wife believe him. Reporters discuss the case and similar ones, and one of them relates a story that may save the innocent man's life.
metadata.Actors: Sally Parr, Patrick Waltz, Walter Reed
